item.title: This line in the pytorch lightning docs broke me a bit: how could the module know which hyperparameters to save??? It doesn't receive them as arguments! The answer is clever: it's reflections through the inspect module 1/ https://t.co/0Ntx3P0oQ0

item.title: Upon calling the function, it saves the outer frame, that is, the context of the caller function. That means it can peak inside the caller function to look at local variables, what values were used for its arguments, etc. 2/ https://t.co/gKohFFSvVV

item.title: So why do that rather than just, say, asking the developer to call save_hyperparameters with *args and **kwargs? Well, save_hyperparameters can do a little more: it can save the arguments to the __init__ functions across the whole class hierarchy. Recursive hparams saved! 3/ https://t.co/3r5GyDx7YH

Well, save_hyperparameters can do a little more: it can save the arguments to the __init__ functions across the whole class hierarchy. Recursive hparams saved! 3/ https://t.co/3r5GyDx7YH
item.content:encoded: So why do that rather than just, say, asking the developer to call save_hyperparameters with *args and **kwargs? Well, save_hyperparameters can do a little more: it can save the arguments to the __init__ functions across the whole class hierarchy. Recursive hparams saved! 3/ https://t.co/3r5GyDx7YH
